ticket.title: ActionView::Helpers::TextHelper#truncate should understand HTML encoding.
ticket.original-body:
I'd like to use the HTML ellipsis (…) as my `:omission` in `#truncate`. The problem is that `#truncate` views that as a string of length 7, not of length 1. That is,
@@@ ruby truncate('A really long string', :length => 10, :omission => '…') # => "A r…" @@@
But since `…` is really a single character in HTML, it should output `"A real…"`.
ticket.latest-body:
I'd like to use the HTML ellipsis (…) as my `:omission` in `#truncate`. The problem is that `#truncate` views that as a string of length 7, not of length 1. That is,
@@@ ruby truncate('A really long string', :length => 10, :omission => '…') # => "A r…" @@@
But since `…` is really a single character in HTML, it should output `"A real…"`.
ticket.original-body-html:
I'd like to use the HTML ellipsis (…) as my :omission in #truncate. The problem is that #truncate views that as a string of length 7, not of length 1. That is,


truncate('A really long string', :length => 10, :omission => '…')
# => "A r…"

But since … is really a single character in HTML, it should output "A real…".

version.body:
I'd like to use the HTML ellipsis (…) as my `:omission` in `#truncate`. The problem is that `#truncate` views that as a string of length 7, not of length 1. That is,
@@@ ruby truncate('A really long string', :length => 10, :omission => '…') # => "A r…" @@@
But since `…` is really a single character in HTML, it should output `"A real…"`.
version.body-html:
I'd like to use the HTML ellipsis (…) as my :omission in #truncate. The problem is that #truncate views that as a string of length 7, not of length 1. That is,


truncate('A really long string', :length => 10, :omission => '…')
# => "A r…"

But since … is really a single character in HTML, it should output "A real…".
version.title: ActionView::Helpers::TextHelper#truncate should understand HTML encoding.

version.body: The problem here is a bit more complicated that it seems. First, what if the user doesn't plan to format as HTML? I know that's an odd case, but should it be supported? If so, how do we know if "…" should be counted as one character or seven? If we do assume that it will always be output as HTML then counting it as one character is simple, as you can see in my attached patch. However, my patch does nothing about the case where we have special characters in the string to be truncated. Even worse, we could end up truncating in the middle of a special character which would be far from desired. There's probably the need for some additional work to be done here.
version.body-html: The problem here is a bit more complicated that it seems. First, what if the user doesn't plan to format as HTML? I know that's an odd case, but should it be supported? If so, how do we know if "…" should be counted as one character or seven? If we do assume that it will always be output as HTML then counting it as one character is simple, as you can see in my attached patch. However, my patch does nothing about the case where we have special characters in the string to be truncated. Even worse, we could end up truncating in the middle of a special character which would be far from desired. There's probably the need for some additional work to be done here.
version.title: ActionView::Helpers::TextHelper#truncate should understand HTML encoding.

version.body: The ellipses in my comment should actually be the HTML string written out.
version.body-html: The ellipses in my comment should actually be the HTML string written out.
version.title: ActionView::Helpers::TextHelper#truncate should understand HTML encoding.

version.body:
We could have used CGI::unescapeHTML here, except it doesn't seem to be working with &#8230. So if there is a rack equivalent of that, it could work here.
Thanks.
version.body-html:
We could have used CGI::unescapeHTML here, except it doesn't seem to be working with &#8230. So if there is a rack equivalent of that, it could work here.

Thanks.
version.title: ActionView::Helpers::TextHelper#truncate should understand HTML encoding.

version.body: `CGI::unescapeHTML` is completely borked. See my question on StackOverflow: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/378847/is-there-a-better-html-escaping-and-unescaping-tool-than-cgi-for-ruby
version.body-html: CGI::unescapeHTML is completely borked. See my question on StackOverflow: http://stackoverflow.com/questio...
version.title: ActionView::Helpers::TextHelper#truncate should understand HTML encoding.
